item.title: Report X-2025010287
item.description:
Report X-2025010287

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-12T03:40:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-04
  • City: CORPUS CHRISTI
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was discovered to the left of the unload trailer when opened at 5:57 a.m. Package was sitting by itself with no boxes below or above it. It was wet but not torn. Upon opening for inspection, it was found to contain 4 gallons of Zep toilet bowl cleaner, one in which was missing the cap causing the spill. All other contents can be wiped and cleaned up. No other packages were damaged. No injuries occurred during the spill.

item.title: Report X-2025010216
item.description:
Report X-2025010216

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-12T03:40:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-19
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the SATR location a fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered. It contained six plastic bottles and one had a loose cap causing the release. The plastic bottles were packaged with packing paper for dunnage. While investigating the shipment the spill agent found a SDS inside of the box stating the contents were UN1805. There were no DG markings or paperwork required for transport on the outer fiberboard box. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location.

item.title: Report E-2025010077
item.description:
Report E-2025010077

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-08T18:17:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-03
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 3, 2024, sixteen (16) pails of paint (gallon and quart) were crushed and released approximately eight (8) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All waste was containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums and nine (9) 5-gallon pails.

item.title: Report X-2025010002
item.description:
Report X-2025010002

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-08T18:17:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-18
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the AFWH location a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. Inside of the fiberboard box was a five gallon plastic bucket and the lid opened up spilling the contents. The spill agent found a SDS inside of the box but it was covered with the spilled contents. They observed that the contents smelled and looked like paint. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location.

item.title: Report E-2025010042
item.description:
Report E-2025010042

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-05
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0720 EST, XPO Logistics terminal LSX notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, 13-gallon metal pail of UN1263, Masterpro refinishing General purpose lacquer thinner was damaged resulting in the release of 3 oz of product to the body of the pail. ERTS reviewed the SDS with XPO, who confirmed terminal personnel were comfortable and capable of cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per the SDS. The impacted pail was containerized into (1) 4-gallon metal drum.
